TopicTitle: CKAN (The Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network); v1.28.0 - Dyson

Articles.Content:
Hi, 

Could someone take a look at Stock Visual Enhancements please, 3 versions have come out in the last 2 weeks which ckan isn't picking up. @Galileo has made some changes to the format of the mod so guessing that's probably why ckan isn't updating automatically?

Thanks

1 minute ago, Torih said:

Hi, 

Could someone take a look at Stock Visual Enhancements please, 3 versions have come out in the last 2 weeks which ckan isn't picking up. @Galileo has made some changes to the format of the mod so guessing that's probably why ckan isn't updating automatically?

Thanks

We're working on it.

2 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

First one is difficult, I've started, but asked for help

2nd one (new reaction wheels) is done

I'll look into why the UpgradeGUI isn't there yet

Why don't you merge the two NK-33 mods into one? Doesn't make sense to have a single part in a mod.  What I'd do is have a single directory (for now, call it MadScientist) as follows:

GameData/MadScientist/Parts/NK33

GameData/MadScientist/Parts/NK33_125

Last one (antenna progression), I've asked the author for permission.

 

Hey linuxgurugamer,

Thank you very much!!

 

And the NK-33 mods aren't mine, they were made by Mad Rocket Scientist .

 

I just want to help with CKAN.

Just now, N3N said:

 

Hey linuxgurugamer,

Thank you very much!!

 

And the NK-33 mods aren't mine, they were made by Mad Rocket Scientist .

 

I just want to help with CKAN.

 

I understand, but you really should ask for permission from the author before this sort of request.

Just now, linuxgurugamer said:

I understand, but you really should ask for permission from the author before this sort of request.

 

Oh, sorry, I didn't want to do the wrong thing, I listed it, because I read it in his post, that he wanted to add it to CKAN and thought he might want help with it.

I didn't want to make a request without his permission. Sorry!

20 minutes ago, N3N said:

 

Oh, sorry, I didn't want to do the wrong thing, I listed it, because I read it in his post, that he wanted to add it to CKAN and thought he might want help with it.

I didn't want to make a request without his permission. Sorry!

Not a problem, I've already asked

5 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

@Olympic1

I make the following as a start for the KPBStoMKS, but it's going to need some work.

specifically, it needs to have at least one of the following mods installed:

MKS, Konstruction, USI-LS, or OSE Workshops

So I'm wondering if you could help: 


{
  "spec_version": "v1.4",
  "install": [
    {
      "install_to": "GameData",
      "find": "KPBStoMKS"
    }
  ],
  "depends": [
    { "name": "ModuleManager" },
    { "name": "KerbalPlanetaryBaseSystems" },
    { "name": "FirespitterCore" }
  ],
  "$vref": "#/ckan/ksp-avc",
  "$kref": "#/ckan/github/DanStaal/KPBStoMKS",
  "x_via": "Automated Linuxgurugamer CKAN script",
  "identifier": "KPBStoMKS",
  "license": "MIT"
}

 

It's a bit of an annoying one but after looking into it, it needs KPBS (obviously) and MM. Because it is mostly made for MKS, I should depend on UKS and recommend/suggest USI-LS, Workshop, ExtraPlanetaryLaunchpads and ConnectedLivingSpace.

2 hours ago, Olympic1 said:

It's a bit of an annoying one but after looking into it, it needs KPBS (obviously) and MM. Because it is mostly made for MKS, I should depend on UKS and recommend/suggest USI-LS, Workshop, ExtraPlanetaryLaunchpads and ConnectedLivingSpace.

It definitely shouldn't reccomend EL because RoverDude has dropped EL in favor of GroundConstruction (which is now a required and bundled dependency). Also don't know why you'd suggest CLS because while both KPBS and MKS have compatibility patches, I wouldn't call it a recommended mod. 

Edited April 19, 2017 by TheRagingIrishman

CLS should probably be Suggested, not Recommended, IMHO. You can throw an explicit dependency to GC Core if you don't want to depend on the one bundled with USI/MKS. Similar goes for CC core (Alista's configurable containers).

On 2017-4-19 at 0:51 PM, politas said:

We're working on it. 

Hi, ckan is now trying to update SVE, I've double checked Github and it appears the work has been done.

However it's trying to install version 1.0 and not 1.2.2, it's also only attempting the textures, the configs are not showing the update:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/osa18rpgaj7ynmz/Screenshot 2017-04-21 02.24.24.png?dl=0

Apologies if its still being worked on

10 hours ago, Torih said:

Hi, ckan is now trying to update SVE, I've double checked Github and it appears the work has been done.

However it's trying to install version 1.0 and not 1.2.2, it's also only attempting the textures, the configs are not showing the update:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/osa18rpgaj7ynmz/Screenshot 2017-04-21 02.24.24.png?dl=0

Apologies if its still being worked on

Yes, as is often the case with SVE updates, the packaging method is all different. You will now need to install "Stock Visual Enhancements", which requires you to install one of the three texture options. The texture packs can thus remain far more stable, and version 1.0 is the correct version number for them (It's actually version 3:1.0 in CKAN) It will probably be easier if you uninstall the existing SVE version and install the new one de novo rather than trying to upgrade.
@politas Thanks, it works just right after the old version is removed.

Hi, Mac user here, and whenever I try to run ckan, whether through the command line or the new ckan.app, terminal tells me it can't find my ksp version in my readme.txt. The readme is still there and displays the correct version number, so I'm not sure what's going on.

 

Edited April 23, 2017 by Deus Zed Machina

17 hours ago, Deus Zed Machina said:

Hi, Mac user here, and whenever I try to run ckan, whether through the command line or the new ckan.app, terminal tells me it can't find my ksp version in my readme.txt. The readme is still there and displays the correct version number, so I'm not sure what's going on.

 

Do you have a buildID.txt file there as well? That is the primary source of version number. What does it say?

2016-12-06_08-18-38
Branch: master

On 25/04/2017 at 2:05 AM, Deus Zed Machina said:

@politas My buildID.txt says the following: 


build id = 01622
2016-12-06_08-18-38
Branch: master

 

Ok, that looks fine. Can you run this at a terminal/command prompt? 

mono ckan.exe ksp list

That should list your ksp install. If it doesn't, you may need to add it with  

mono ckan.exe ksp add <name> /absolute/path/to/ksp/directory/

mono ckan.exe ksp add <name> /absolute/path/to/ksp/directory/

Yeah, turns out I was wrong :S every time I try to add a new path though, it shows the list of commands and doesn't add the new path as far as I can tell

I am having trouble with getting the correct version of certain mods to load.

CKAN is reporting Auto Detect on final frontier mod but KSP AVC is reporting I'm not on the correct version.  I have manually deleted the FInal Frontier directory and recopied them to game data but this has not solved the problem. I am not sure how I should fix this.

 

Edited April 27, 2017 by Lucky Spacer
get ckan image in post

3 hours ago, Lucky Spacer said:

I am having trouble with getting the correct version of certain mods to load.

CKAN is reporting Auto Detect on final frontier mod but KSP AVC is reporting I'm not on the correct version.  I have manually deleted the FInal Frontier directory and recopied them to game data but this has not solved the problem. I am not sure how I should fix this.

 

Try closing CKAN, deleting the mod manually from the GameData folder and then re-opening CKAN.  Download and reinstall Final Frontier from the Compatible list.

I'm not sure if there is a file in the FF directory that you need to keep to preserve your current game awards.  Check that out first but it's likely that these are stored in the persistent.sfs file (under the HallofFameScenario).

Edited April 28, 2017 by Brigadier
Added warning

3 hours ago, Lucky Spacer said:

I am having trouble with getting the correct version of certain mods to load.

CKAN is reporting Auto Detect on final frontier mod but KSP AVC is reporting I'm not on the correct version.  I have manually deleted the FInal Frontier directory and recopied them to game data but this has not solved the problem. I am not sure how I should fix this.

 

Note that under "Installed" it says "AD".  That means you installed it manually, CKAN will not touch it.  Thus it will not update it even though it's out of date.  Uninstall manually, then install with CKAN.

9 hours ago, Deus Zed Machina said:

 

Yeah, turns out I was wrong :S every time I try to add a new path though, it shows the list of commands and doesn't add the new path as far as I can tell

Are there any spaces in the path to your ksp install, or other characters that might be messing with the ckan command?

On 4/27/2017 at 6:37 PM, Loren Pechtel said:

Note that under "Installed" it says "AD".  That means you installed it manually, CKAN will not touch it.  Thus it will not update it even though it's out of date.  Uninstall manually, then install with CKAN.

 

On 4/27/2017 at 6:31 PM, Brigadier said:

Try closing CKAN, deleting the mod manually from the GameData folder and then re-opening CKAN.  Download and reinstall Final Frontier from the Compatible list.

I'm not sure if there is a file in the FF directory that you need to keep to preserve your current game awards.  Check that out first but it's likely that these are stored in the persistent.sfs file (under the HallofFameScenario).

This worked.  I had missed one of the manual FInal Frontier installs I had done.  Thank you very much.
